benchmark_details.name: TRIAGE Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: TRIAGE is a novel machine ethics benchmark that tests LLMsâ€™ ability to make ethical decisions during mass casualty incidents using real-world ethical dilemmas with clear solutions designed by medical professionals.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark ethical decision-making capabilities of large language models in medical contexts, specifically during mass casualty situations.

data.source: Triage training materials for the START and jumpSTART models.

methodology.calculation: Correctness evaluated by the accuracy of triage assignments.
methodology.interpretation: Models' performance compared against random guessing.
methodology.baseline_results: All models except Mistral outperform random guessing.
methodology.validation: Evaluated models' ability to assign patients to correct triage groups across various ethical contexts.
